column4: i burnt a bootable cd using gnome baker, and it doesnt seem to boot into it, and ive checked and the burn was successfull, any ideas?
its windows xp 32 bit, no im not pirating, its for work,  we have one of those network liscenses, boss asked me to burn a copy
might be too fast for an iso
i burn my cd images at 4x to make sure there are no errors
ok ill try a different speed, but are their any settings i need to do , i have it set to burnfree off, dummy write off, mode disabled
and i also do a md5sum check after i burn it onto cd by making an iso off the burnt cd then comparing
how do i compare it to the iso?
not totally sure on the exact software in linux to use to make the iso i know there are some
right now i do most of my multimedia tasks on windows
i use Ultra iso to burn my  isos.. and to extract the isos from the burned disk
